title: Can America's Loss Become India's Gain? | Why Trump Went Nuclear On H1B Visas | Akash Banerjee
description:
President Trumpâ€™s H1B announcement has sent shockwaves - hitting Indians the hardest. A single executive order has sent panic across the tech industry and left lakhs of H1B visa holders staring at an uncertain future. What was once a dream path to Silicon Valley may now become unaffordable overnight.
But is Trump truly protecting American jobs, or is this a political theatre - designed to fire up Trumpâ€™s base? Even if the US shuts its doors, will India really benefit from the return of talent or is that just another fantasy? In todayâ€™s Deshbhakt episode, we break down Trumpâ€™s $100K visa bomb, its impact on India and whether America is sabotaging itself in the process.

ğŸš¨After deliberately misleading the world with false statements on VISA TIMELINES - Karoline Leavitt clarifies on H1B Mess 
(was this confusion deliberate to create panic and force people to leave?) 
1.) This is NOT an annual fee. Itâ€™s a one-time fee that applies only to the petition.
(annual would have totally killed H1B)
2.) Those who already hold H-1B visas and are currently outside of the country right now will NOT be charged $100,000 to re-enter. 
3.) H-1B visa holders can leave and re-enter the country to the same extent as they normally would; whatever ability they have to do that is not impacted by yesterdayâ€™s proclamation.
(thank go for small mercies) 
3.) This applies only to new visas, not renewals, and not current visa holders.  It will first apply in the next upcoming lottery cycle.
(the H1B crisis is still coming - next year and Trump may not stop here)

title: The Untold Story | How Election Commission Of India Was Made - Then Unmade | Akash Banerjee
description:
In 1951, India attempted the impossible - conducting the largest democratic experiment in the world (with very limited means) Ever since then - India's democratic system & her Election Commission has been proving western naysayers wrong; proving that India can overcome numerous challenges & yet prove to a democratic nation which conducts largely free and fair elections. 

Its not that the EC has not had its challenges - from booth capturing in the 70s & 80s - to the iron hand of TT. N. Seshan in the 90s...from no code to the MCC .... from paper ballots to EVMs - every Election Commission has had to fight its own battled. But why is the Election Commission of India today - facing its worse crisis ever? What changed in this once glorious institution that politicians feared and respected.
Who caused this reputational damage and can the EC of India be repaired?

title: The Real Bengal Files | Jinnahâ€™s Direct Action Day & Lessons Unlearnt From History  | Akash Banerjee
description:
16th August 1946  - a dark day - when Kolkata burned, thousands were killed and the dream of a United India was shattered forever. What began as â€œDirect Actionâ€ turned into one of the most shameful chapters of our freedom struggle.
But was The Great Calcutta Killings only about Hindu-Muslim hatred or was it the result of deadly political games, soaring ambitions, provocative speeches and inaction of those in power?
Nearly 80 years later, why does this event still matter? What role did Jinnah, Suhrawardy and the Congress play? Why couldnâ€™t Gandhi stop the bloodshed that followed? And most importantly - what lessons are we ignoring even today, as our politics and society seem to walk a dangerously familiar path? 
Decoding that and a lot more - in this Deshbhakt special episode.

Floods, landslides, and cloudbursts have become frighteningly routine, with shocking visuals repeating year after year. Because if these disasters are now so predictable, then why does nothing change? Are we pushing the mountains and nature to a point of no return, ignoring warning after warning? The answers reveal a crisis thatâ€™s far bigger than just rain and itâ€™s one that India can no longer afford to overlook.

title: Pt.2 | Air India Crash Report | Deliberate Crash OR Massive Failure - Experts Split | Akash Banerjee
description:
A preliminary crash report - within one month of the crash - is supposed help solve / answer some of the questions after a air-crash. The AI171 Preliminary report has managed to do the opposite - the cryptic messaging and selective omissions in the report have given birth to even more conspiracy theories - including deliberate crashing of the aircraft. 
Eerily this is what happened after the 737-Max crashed - where the whole blame fell on the pilots - under the real culprit was found.

So who's to blame - man or machine? Have you made up your mind? Then you need to watch this episode.

title: Man Or Machine? | What Brought Down Air India Flight 171? - Conspiracy Vs Facts | Akash Banerjee

However to put conspiracy theorists at bay - here are 7 things that the investigators will have to look into - to solve this riddle. It could be mechanical - but there is ONE probability - that is staring us in the face and its not pretty.

title: Now Youtube Vs Youtubers? | How Content Creators Are Being Snuffed Out In India | Akash Banerjee
description:
News / Infotainment creators are getting content strikes at a record rate. Channels are facing the prospect of deletion for the 'crime' of using a few seconds of copyright content. While the internet is divided over who's right and who's wrong & what is 'fair use' - very little focus is being given to the REAL cause of this mess. 
A US made law - that has little relevance for @youtubecreators in India - but massive scope of misuse. Will @YouTube act to save news content creators in India or is this the end??

24 hour after Operation Sindoor came to a surprising pause - PM Narendra Modi addressed the nation and made it clear that the fight with Pakistan based terror will carry on. 
But on the Pakistani side - there is no show of compromise or relief - it is celebration over a military 'win' and downing of Rafael jets ... 
India however is clear - we hit their targets & a new red line has been drawn - any terrorism from Pakistan -  will be treated as an act of war. 
So what next???

description:
Two weeks after the cowardly Pahalgam Attack - while the perpetrators are still at large - action against Pakistan is becoming more evident with each passing day. However the Govt has also clamped down on any uncomfortable questions about lapses that led to Pahalgam. Is it 'too soon' to ask questions from our Govt?? What has been the BJP's track record of asking questions after a Pakistani attack- when it was in the opposition?? 
Why India needs to do BOTH - ask questions to itself and give Pakistan a befitting answer.

description:

Without IMF support the nation's economy would collapse - yet its Army Chief publically dreams of Kashmir and vows to help the 'brave' in the valley.

title: Ranveer Allahbadia Controversy | Just The Tip Of Indiaâ€™s MASSIVE Vulgarity Crisis? | Akash Banerjee
description:
MASSIVE blowback to Ranveer Allahbadia's crass joke in Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show. 
But the kind of police action / NCW summons / even Parliamentary Panel note - shows that something bigger is afoot. Is this a pretext for some Govt action on Digital Media??? 

No doubt that Ranveer and Samay have a lot of answer for - but compared to the filth on social media today - this was kindergarten stuff. There is an urgent need to stop the vulgarity that is spreading on Social Media - else the Govt will have every right to clamp down of what we consume and how.

Digital India has a massive vulgarity crisis and we need to act NOW.

title: The Truth Of Savarkar | Rationalist, Veer, Or British Stooge? | Deshbhakt Samvaad With Arun Shourie
description:
There have been endless effort to resurrect the image of "Veer" Savarkar - from numerous books to even movies now .... but what is the REAL legacy of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar?? What do the facts say about him?? Does his OWN writing expose him??? Was he crusading rationalist?  / 'Veer' Freedom Fighter / or a grovelling agent of the British?

Arun Shoure took time off to have a detailed chat on Savarkar, his ideas for India and why Savarkar remained affectionate towards the British - right till the end.

title: Deepseek Destroys American AI | How China Is Winning The Tech War | Where Is India? | Akash Banerjee

title: The Tragic Death Of Journalism In India | Mukesh Chandrakar Murder Case | Akash Banerjee
description:
We have been so inspired by politicians - that our hypocrisy doesn't have any limits now. When someone will tell us that in 2023 - 5 journalists were killed and 226 were targeted by state agencies, non-state political actors, anti-social elements, and criminals across India - we will not bat an eyelid. But if an international ranking puts us at 160 / 180 in press freedom - all hell brakes-lose 

Mukesh Chandrakar's brutal end is a reminder to us - how genuine / small town journalism is being eradicated. Either you have to sell your soul and those who chose to work and use Digital Broadcast as a tool - are being silenced by other means. This is not an exception - this is the rule now....

#mukeshchandrakar #pressfreedom #journalismmatters

title: Which Model Will Make For A Better India? | Deshbhakt Samvaad With Manish Sisodia & Jasmine Shah
description:
With Delhi Assembly Elections just around the bend - all eyes are on a AAP vs BJP fight. The Aam Aadmi Party is confident that its 'Delhi Model' will ensure them a victory - but what is the Delhi Model of Governance ??? Is it only a basket of freebies for potential voters or a form of welfare governance that makes lives better? 

AAP Leader Jasmine Shah has just come out with a new book detailing the making and working of the Delhi Model and why this actually works much better than the hyped Gujarat Model. Shah believes that this is a model that can be used pan-India to make the country better.

We sit down with Former Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and Jasmine Shah to understand the Delhi Model - how it works (what parts did not) and if such a model can exist and thrive in todays India that is marred by personality and identity politics.

title: Undoing The Places of Worship Act | Keeping India On The Edge For Next 70 Years? | Akash Banerjee
description:
The Places of Worship Act was passed in 1991 - so that after Ayodhya - no character of any other religious place be changed from what it was in 1947. Despite the act being specifically designed to save India from digging up the past - there are atleast SIX cases coming up for hearing in higher courts - that challenge the sanctity and very existence of old mosques in India. 

Why the sudden spurt of cases? How come the courts are passing orders so quickly? Is this all a coincidence ??? Or a well thought out plan to force the system to give a certain outcome. Is India going into an Ayodhya 2.0 phase?

title: ICC Arrest Warrant Against Netanyahu | Time For Israel To Answer For Crimes? | Akash Banerjee
description:
The International Criminal Court (ICC) has reportedly issued arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, and Hamas leader Mohammad Deif. The ongoing crisis in Gaza, which began on October 7 following Hamas's attack on Israel, has escalated into a devastating humanitarian disaster. The decades-long conflict between Israel and Palestine continues to claim innocent lives. Can there ever be an end to this violence?

As a staunch ally of Israel, can the United States remain silent about the plight of Palestinians? What does this mean for global geopolitics, justice, and humanity? Join The Deshbhakt as we delve into this complex issue and explore whether justice can prevail in one of the worldâ€™s most protracted conflicts.

title: Who's Agent Is Deshbhakt? CIA / ISI / TMC / INC / AAP??  | Constitution Day Special | Akash Banerjee
description:
Every 26th November we celebrate as Constitution Day. Every 26th November we remember the immense contribution of Dr. Ambedkar towards holding this great and diverse nation together.
But while we know something about India's Constitution - what about our own Constitution? 
What are the principles we are willing to fight for - willing to die for? Presenting for the first time - here's Deshbhakt's Constitution - the code that we have lived and worked by for the last 6 years. Perhaps the proudest feeling - of never having compromised on the ideas we had set out with. 
What's your personal Constitution?

title: What 'Legacy' Does Chief Justice Chandrachud Leave Behind? | Akash Banerjee & Adwaith
description:
Days before he quit as the 50th Chief Justice of India - CY Chandrachud was worried about the kind of 'Legacy' he was leaving behind? Was he an effective judge who stood by Democracy and the Constitution or was he a 'practical' CJI who did the best under the circumstances? Will the future give him glowing tributes or remember him as the one who disappointed??? Lets take a closer look.

title: Who Created Harappan / Indus Valley Civilisation? | How Did It End? | Samvaad With Devdutt Pattanaik
description:
A little over a 100 years since the Harappan Civilisation was discovered - it continues to fascinate archeologists, historians and researchers. We do know a lot more today than we did a century ago about this amazing civilisation - but now mythologist Devdutt Pattanaik, in his new book, has challenged a lot of beliefs about the Indus Valley Civilisation that we thought were true since our school days.

Was there really an 'Aryan Invasion'? / Who ruled over the Indus Valley Settlements? / What are the famed 'seals' from the era telling us? / What propelling this civilisation for over 500 years and where did it go after? - this and a lot more in an packed hour long discussion with Devdutt Pattanaik.

title: The Khalistan Movement & Why Its Seeing A Revival In Canada | Akash Banerjee & Adwaith
description:
It's an issue that evokes strong passions - yet Khalistan was a topic that was almost relegated to the history books ... but over the last few years the demand for Khalistan has gained traction - especially in the diaspora. 

Why is the pull for Khalistan so strong in many? Can India be subjected to the same level of violence that we saw in the 1980's? How has this movement spread to Canada and where does the Govt of India go from here? 

In special Deshbhakt Deep-dive tracks the history - the spread - near death and the resurrection of this movement in a foreign land....

title: End Of American Dadagiri & Dollar Domination? | BRICS To Create A Multipolar World? | Akash Banerjee
description:
The success of BRICS Summit 2024 is being seen as a clear indication that the world order is desperately seeking a change - many have had enough with US political hegemony and abuse of Dollar domination in the global economy. 
BRICS seems to have sown the seeds of a counterbalance to US and G7 domination - already the western plan to isolate Russian President Putin seems to have fail miserably with most of the developing economies coming together in Kazan, Russia - to show their power.

But can the world become multipolar ??? Can the absolute domination of the dollar challenged ??? Can SWIFT be replaced with something else??? We find out.

title: Reality Of 'Digital Arrest' | How To Protect Yourself From Online Fraud | Akash Banerjee & Rishi
description:
India's Digital Revolution has made lives easier - for us and for criminals too.
Online scams and digital frauds are at an all-time high, with lakhs and crores of rupees lost by Indian citizens. Some even taking their lives.

For this episode - team deshbhakt spent a lot of time scanning the web to spot the most common types of frauds happening in our digital space. Weâ€™ll look at how these scammers operate, the steps the government is taking to address this issue and what we as citizens can do to protect ourselves.

This episode is copyright free - so share / download / circulate as us wish - but do let your loved ones know how common this has become and that anyone could be next.

title: Why is Modi Govt Not Able To Start Trail Against Scamsters / Naxals & Terrorists? | Akash Banerjee
description:
Much to the embarrassment of the BJP Govt - the SC has released Arvind Kejriwal on bail (along with most of the accused in the Delhi Liquor Scam Case). On the same day - a Delhi Court acquitted 10  people in connection with the Delhi Riots Case. Also most of the high profile arrests in the Bhima Koregao case are on bail. 
Why has the Modi govt failed to start trial - even in the most high profile of cases? Why is Umar Khalid in jail despite Govt having 4 YEARS to start a trial? Wither the BJP Govt is scam / riots and terror friendly .... or it never really had any evidence - the idea was to just jail political opponents.

title: Truth Of Ramayan Hidden From Us? | What Was The Real Purpose of Ravan? | Samvaad With Ashutosh Rana
description:
The Mega Theatrical Production - Humare Ram (Ft Ashutosh Rana as Ravan and Rahull Bhuchar as Shri Ram) has been making waves across India. However what is commendable (besides brilliant cast / production values / screenplay) is the unique outlook towards Ramayan that this production takes. 

In this episode of Deshbhakt Samvad - we sit down with actor, author, thinker - Ashutosh Rana to understand the real meaning of Ramayan... the real message of Shri Ram and why its important to understand Ravan to appreciate the greatness of Bhagwan Shri Ram. 

If you would like to jump around in the interview!!! - 
0:00 - 4:00 - Coming Up Conversation with Ashutosh Rana 
4:00 - 7:30 - Using Name Of Shri Ram for Commerce vs Elevating Audiences Via Ramayan
7:30 - 11:00 - Understand Shri Ram Thought The Eyes Of Ravan (Sadhan vs Saadhna) 
11:00 - 15:45 - The UNTOLD Chapters of Ramayan 
15:45 - 19:00 - A 'weak' Shri Ram? Surrounded by Questions?? 
19:00 - 29:30 - Param Shiv Bhakt? Pandit Ravan? - WHY?? 
29:30 - 41:00 - Ramayan as a timeless Political Commentary
41:00 - 49:00 - Author / Thinker Aushtosh Rana !!! Lessons from Ramayan for today 
49:00 - 52:00 - Role and Acceptance of Satire in India Today
52:00 - 56:30 - India As the Pocket Edition Of The World 
56:30 - 1:05:00 - Social Media As Your Visiting Card / Introduction 
1:05:00 - 1:12:30 - Elevating your thought process and broadening your vision 
1:12:30 - 1:19:00 - Theatre vs Mainstream Cinema!

title: Reality of Waqf Boards | Modi's Big Reform or Land-grab? | Akash Banerjee & Adwaith
description:
When it comes to Waqf - there are many layers of complexities. First there is lot of misunderstanding around the basic concept of Waqf .... Second issue is further compounded by the brazen misuse of this Islamic provision. Third on top of this - the BJP Govt wants to amend the act that controls Waqf Boards - opening up a pandora's box of claims and counterclaims.

In this episode of Deshbhakt - we look at the basic idea of the Waqf - its use / misuse / why there is so much opposition to Modi's Reform Bill.

title: Can Bollywood Box Office Predict Election Results Better Than Exit Polls? | Akash Banerjee & Mohit
description:
Kashmir Files, Kerala Story, Gadar 2 - low budget movies that reaped massive rewards on the Box Office .... after this there was a literal flood of Bollywood movies that used religion / nationalism / political propaganda to mint money on the box office - but what happened to this formula in the months leading to Lok Sabha Elections 2024? 

Did the box office performance of these movies predict the decline of BJP's formula on using nationalism and religion to garner votes? Did the Bollywood Box office do a much better job of predicting the election results than 'elaborate' EXIT POLLS? 

We do the maths!

title: Why does @dhruvrathee get so much support - while creators like @FlyingBeast320 are struggling?
description:
Very important question raised by Gaurav Taneja about Dhruv Rathee's 'control' over internet content & conversation.
A primary reason for this is because most of the 10M+ creators have started to treat their loyal audiences as money making machines. Someone is buying a 10 crore farmhouse, another one has become a snake charmer, while the third one never gets tired of showing off his gold plated iPhone. 
While making money is not a sin - most creators have stopped caring about the struggles of their core audience. (Who wants to anger the Supreme Leader!!) 
That's where Dhruv stepped in and won the trust of Young India - talking about issues that impacts them - rather then showing only a rich lifestyle. For the SAME reason creators like Taneja are feeling the pinch - witnessing a massive stagnation in their online growth....cuz their audience is seeing through the fakeness. 
While no one expects snake-charmers to make videos on NEET & NTA - its disappointing to note that not a SINGLE PEEP from Gaurav Taneja - an IIT alumnus - on the burning NEET issue. Entrance exams is something he could have taken up with authority - rallied support for lakhs of students - in return he could have gained some trust & goodwill....but that would have taken some balls to do and lots of business risk.
Taneja seems to have chosen the easier option - reduce himself to an godi-influencer who gets arrested for a 'party' & trolls Dhruv Rathee....rather than ask tough questions to the Govt on behalf of his core audience.
Enjoy the loot Taneja, but don't grudge others to choose to matter.

#dhruvrathee #gauravtaneja #thedeshbhakt

title: End Of Independent YouTube Creators like #dhruvrathee & #ravishkumar ?? #thedeshbhakt #broadcastbill
description:
After the staggering success of news platforms and news content creators native to social media during the elections â€“ the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has proposed to regulate them DIRECTLY under the new Broadcasting Services (Regulation) Bill which is currently in its drafting stage.
If this happens - it's goodbye to free, fearless online content creation.

title: Jammu New Terror Target? | 4 Ways To Teach The Pakistani Deep-state A Lesson | Akash Banerjee
description:
In about 4 days - there have 4 attacks in the Jammu region ... all in a bid by our neighbour to rake up unrest in Jammu. Why Jammu this time? Is Pakistan trying to open up a new front against India? Why now?

title: NEET Scam - Who Gives A S**t For Students? | Exam Scam - Part 1 | Akash Banerjee & Adwaith
description:
After a week of the shocking NEET scam coming to light; the Supreme Court heard petitions seeking to cancel the NEET-UG 2024 exam....as expected - they acknowledged the issue, issued notice to NTA, but allowed the admission process to continue. 
Despite protests - the Govt & authorities have not even bothered to answer student concerns properly - even when the career of lakhs of youngsters is on the line.
After SC's refusal to interfere - students will have to face the harsh reality of a new India ... where testing scams and paper leaks happen with frightening regularity - with no one to be held accountable.
A special request to students by Team Deshbhakt - grow up, grow a spine, speak out.... Youtubers will not save this nation. The youth will.

title: MASSIVE Fake News Flood In Elections 2024! | How Citizens Can Fight Back! | Alt News | Pratik Sinha
description:
As India goes to polls - news and especially Fake News will be a big driver of the narrative that people consume and the distractions that will keep them away from the real issues.
I sit with with AltNews Co-Founder Pratik Sinha - a man who knows more about Fake News Busting than any other man in india - and discuss with him the impact of Misinformation in Elections 2024, the future of AI powered fake news, the controversial arrest of Zubair and what WE as citizens can do to minimise the impact impact of misinformation that is being generated at an industrial scale.

title: EXPLAINED - Representation of People Act | How Modi's Toolkit Mocked the Law | Akash Banerjee
description:
With Phase 1 of campaigning over - one thing is clear - there is no 'wave' for any party or alliance .... there is no emotional pull towards the BJP like after Balakot. With a poor performance report-card - the BJP seems to be slipping back to its old formula to use Religion as a crutch. Only problem is that the Representation of People Act, 1951 makes this clearly illegal - something that the Supreme Court reiterated in 2017 via a 7 member bench. Yet its the religion card all over again.

While the EC is sleeping on this - here's what you should know about the law and what traps to avoid as an aware citizen. 

For all things legal, follow - https://www.livelaw.in/
You can follow Manu Sebastian, Managing Editor, Live Law on X here - @manuvichar

title: Patanjali Vs Supreme Court | How Baba Ramdev Grew Powerful Enough to Mock The Law | Akash Banerjee
description:
It's become a fashion these days in the Supreme Court - Lie to or Mock the SC and then just give an apology.  Anil Masih after the Chandigarh Mayoral fiasco then the SBI's brazen lying over Electoral Bonds and now Baba Ramdev. Caught over open contempt of court - Baba Ramdev is saying sorry....but how come over the last so many years no one stopped or checked Baba - as he broke so many norms and legal provisions????

This is the story of Baba Ramdev and Patanjali - how it became so powerful that it took even the Supreme Court for granted. Will the SC tolerate this insult ????

title: Reality Of Ramayana | Lessons From Lord Ram & Shivbhakt Ravan | Akash Banerjee
description:
2023 saw Adipurush - based on the life of Lord Ram - it became one of the biggest Bollywood movie disasters of all time. 2024 is witnessed another attempt - this time with Ranbir Kapoor at the lead. But Bollywood directors really need to take a hard look at a play called Humare Ram that is setting the theater circuit on FIRE. Not only does it explore new aspects of the Epic Ramayan - it also manages to pass on some of the core values of Bhagwan Shri Ram. Truly a work of art and some amazing acting - only if Bollywood could learn!

title: EXPLAINED - Paytm Broken Beyond Repair? | Can Vijay Shekhar Sharma Save It? | Akash Banerjee
description:
They were the biggest unicorns of India - leaders in their sectors. Byjus in Edtech and Paytm in Fintech.... both have seen dramatic falls in the last few months - both businesses led by insanely talented & intensely ambitious founders.... but just like in Byjus case - ego & overconfidence got the better of Vijay Shekhar Sharma.
This is the story of the rise and the fall of Paytm - why things would have collapsed anyways - even without the RBI sledgehammer that fell on Paytm Payments Bank. 
So what next for VSS and more importantly - what lessons for the startup industry??

title: How SBI Mocked Supreme Court of India | Wants To Reveal Electoral Bond Details AFTER 2024 Elections!
description:
On the 15th of Feb, the Supreme Court in a landmark judgement, held Electoral Bonds unconstitutional. It was the very instrument that the BJP brought in - allowing it to amass thousands of crores of rupees in 'secret' funding. The SC had directed the SBI to give all the details of Electoral Bond purchases to the Election Commission by the 6th of March and that the EC would publish these details by the 15th of March. 

Now SBI is 'requesting' more time to get this data - time enough for the 2024 elections to get over - so that this information become redundant to the voter. Will the SC swallow this bitter pill or can it at least allow for the biggest donors to be revealed - so that people can make an informed choice???

title: Did Manmohan Singh Crash India's Economy? | Dirty Truth of Modi's â€˜White Paperâ€™ | Akash Banerjee
description:
Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented a 'White Paper' on the UPA's Economic Policy in the Lok Sabha - it outlined UPAâ€™s 10 years of mismanagement & policy paralysis.... More importantly it aimed to show how - the NDA extracted the nation from a massive 'crisis'.

title: Why Pakistan Imploded | From Economic 'Role Model' to Terror 'Safe Haven' | Akash Banerjee & Adwaith
description:
In the 1960's Pakistan was the poster-boy for development ... her GDP was growing at a faster trot than India, Pakistan's per-capita income for a long time was almost the same as of India - sometimes even more... what then led to the virtual implosion of a nation that was once compared to South Korea? This is the story of the Asian 'role model' state and how in a short time it transformed into a politically unstable, economically bankrupt, terror safe haven. We unearth the core reasons and lessons that this country's spectacular fall has for others.

title: How Hitler Used Attack on Parliament to become 'Supreme Leader' | Akash Banerjee
description:
On February 27, 1933 a portion of the German parliament â€œReichstagâ€ went up in flames... it was seen as an attack on the very heart of Germany and Hitler used this one incident to cement his ABSOLUTE control over Germany. If there is one date that can be pinned when Democracy died in Germany - it was the day that the Parliament was attacked and the events that unfolded after it.
Moral of the story - Democracies are fragile - determined people while the right skills can undo it - with remarkable ease and in no time. 
Have we learnt any lessons from history? Or are we destined to repeat it?

title: While We Watched feat. Ravish Kumar | Vinay Shukla's Work Shows Bitter Truth About Media & Audiences
description:
At a time when NDTV had no ratings, no money and tons of cases filed by the Govt... there was one man who refused to be cowed down. Ravish Kumar with his skeletal staff still churned out the journalism that questioned the system on Prime Time.
At a time when Ravish got abuses as recognition - at a time it became fashionable to be authoritarian cheerleader - Ravish kept doing what he knew best. Analysing and speaking the blunt truth.

It was in this dark hour that Vinay Shukla decided to document the life of Ravish Kumar and the decent of Indian Media into chaos. 5 years of labour resulted in a stunning documentary called - While We Watched .... 

It has been getting rave reviews abroad - but there is no distributor who's willing to touch this documentary in India. Ironically that itself proves the point of the makers. In this detailed chat with Vinay and Ravish - we get into the making and the message of While We Watched

title: India's Name Changing to Bharat? | Masterstroke or Jumla? | Akash Banerjee
description:
A leak from 'sources' has set social media and dinner table conversations on FIRE !!!

title: 1947 REPEAT? - Can Hate Divide India Again? | Partition Remembrance Day | Akash Banerjee
description:
The Partition of India 76yrs ago, ripped United India into 2 nations based on religious identity. What caused the partition? - Who's to blame? - Who fanned the fires? While there is a lot of debate over those questions - one thing is clear ... hate took a devastating toll in 1947 and more than seven decades later - similar mistakes are being made. 

A day before Independence Day - on 14th of August - India has started commemorating #partitionhorrorsremembranceday  .... On Deshbhakt we take a deep drive into how India was split - how hate was fanned, who profited from it and why we must remember and learn from the mistakes made more than 7 decades ago.

title: Explained - Uniform Civil Code | Modi's One Nation One Law by 2024? | Akash Banerjee & Adwaith

title: EXPOSED!  - How the Supreme Court called out the Lies of Kerala Story | Akash Banerjee
description:
#TheKeralaStory has already minted 150cr+ and this intervention by the Supreme Court might be a little late in the day - but in a major embarrassment to the movie makers - the SC today ordered that a disclaimer be inserted in the movie - saying that this movie is a fictionalised version of events & that there's no data to back claims being made here. While this will not change the course of the movie on the Box Office - this kills the attempt of the movie makers to portray this as a serious work of cinema and research.

*** 6 months ago we put out a video - running u though the real & the claimed numbers. At that time director SUDIPTO SEN INSISTED that the number was right! ...but when the movie got enough traction - be backed out...perhaps the greatest marketing move!
https://youtu.be/cVZe2G18uuE

*** If u have not watched #TheKeralaStory then u can. Just remember - u are watching a work of fiction with no data to back it & tons of hate politics to serve. It does show the brutal reality of ISIS & then marries it to Kerala using the logic of 3 = 32000.
https://youtu.be/XUQbdgqeZRw

title: Reality behind Manipur Violence that left 50+ Dead | The Deshbhakt ft. Tora Agarwala
description:
Ethnic clashes are always complicated to understand - especially if you are sitting a thousand kilometres away.... add to that local geography / deep historical fault lines / geopolitics & domestic political compulsions.... then you get a sense of HOW COMPLICATED is the landscape of Manipur. It was all these factors at play - that resulted in this terrible tragedy. 

We spoke at length with Tora Agarwala - who covers the North East for The Indian Express. The idea behind this detailed chat is to go behind the headlines and understand how this violence had been building up for some time - how local politicians took the fragile peace of Manipur for granted and how the state has undone a lot of fwd. movement it had achieved. 

Apologies for my poor audio - but Tora Agarwala has a wealth of information and expertise to share!!! 

Follow Tora on Twitter for all the NE updates - @ToraAgarwala
Follow Express Explained to understand complex issues in a simple way! - https://indianexpress.com/section/explained/

title: Bharat Jodo Yatra & the Remaking of Rahul Gandhi - Will it Work? | Akash Banerjee
description:
Unarguably Rahul Gandhi's most successful move in his political career - the "Bharat Jodo Yatra" that started from Kanyakumari - after a brief halt in Delhi - is moving towards Srinagar. More than the claims made by the Congress - its the acts of the BJP - that show just how important BJY has become. If Rahul is a failed joke - then why the daily attacks? Why is the Govt so nervous? What does BJY mean for RaGa's political 'return' ?? Most importantly what does BJY do for the Congress in the long-run....will this lead to political change in any way or just remain a road show?

description:

title: Life after NDTV for Ravish Kumar | 28yrs - 28 questions by Akash Banerjee & Bhakt Banerjee
description:
After 28 long years at @NDTV  - @ravishkumar.official finally resigned from the company that is synonymous with his name and work. He quit just hours after Pronoy Roy and Radhika Roy resigned from NDTV's holding company and just as Adani formally took over the company. 

Ravish has always spoken his mind - and we hope that he will now do so on Youtube. Featured here are 28 answers to various topics that Ravish game to Akash Banerjee and Bhakt Banerjee over the course of 4 years in 4 separate interviews. Do follow his work Youtube - his subscribers are racing up and if you want the links to all detailed interviews - they are listed here as well.

title: Why Munugode Election Results Matter to BJP, TRS & Congress | Akash Banerjee
description:
Munugode was one of the seven constituencies that had gone for by elections on the 3rd of November. BJP managed to win 4 of these - TRS, RJD and Sena won the rest. But what is fascinating is how Munugode became a war of egos between the BJP and TRS - money and liquor flowed freely and money to the tune of 10 - 15K per voter is said to have been spent ! The Congress lost its deposit despite Rahul Gandhi's yatra crossing the state - this is why one small constituency election has important signals for all!

description:
The Morbi Bridge Collapse is now amongst the worst in the world in terms of lives lost - this is more than Act of God or Act of Fraud - this needs to be investigated at the highest levels as an Act of Terror. There seem to have been slips at multiple levels and now every attempt is being made to shift the blame. While the role of the public and the maintenance company should be looked into - there real responsibility lies somewhere else.

If people don't wake up - this shifting of blame will be successful too.

title: Morbi Bridge Collapse - God's Message to Gujarat & Modi? | Akash Banerjee
description:
The 2016 Bridge Collapse Tragedy in Kolkata had killed 27 people and injured 50. Just days later Modi blamed Mamata Banerjee for the tragedy and claimed it was God's message to the people of Bengal to save the state from her rule....today just weeks before Gujarat elections - a similar tragedy has struck the state killing close to a 100. 
Should this also be seen as God's message against the BJP and Modi???  How low should one get in politics? Asking for votes over people's dead bodies? - what't the Lakshman Rekha???

title: Why Kantara Works (& Bollywood does not) | Akash Banerjee
description:
Kantara, the low budget sandalwood movie is running successfully all over India and is close to amassing Rs. 160 crore. But what makes this film special is a compelling storyline that deals with topics like tribal rights, caste oppression, environmental protection and forest land encroachment with stunning visuals and music. 

But what Bollywood is lacking that it is unable to cook such a hit recipe? We analyse this and much more in this episode of The Deshbhakt

title: Manish Sisodia & the Liquor Scam | Is AAP Hiding a Dirty Secret? | Akash Banerjee
description:
AAP's No.2 and Delhi Deputy-CM Manish Sisodia is no stranger to controversy - however he now faces the biggest direct against him. After Delhi's Health Minister was booked by the ED -(still in Jail since May) the CBI now has come knocking at Manish Sisodia's door claiming that Delhi's new Liquor Policy had resulted in financial impropriety and that the Liquor Mafia was given benefits.

What is the truth?
What is this policy that AAP was forced to scrap?
What is the politics of this raid? 
This and a lot more politics in this episode!

title: Enforcement Directorate & PMLA | How Congress & BJP shaped a deadly tool | Akash Banerjee
description:
Over the last 17yrs - the Enforcement Directorate filed Over 5,400 Money Laundering cases under PMLA Act. It secured only 23 convictions in court - that's less than a 0.5% conviction rate!!! The rise of ED to a super CBI is fascinating. Politicised by the congress - Weaponised by the BJP.

Prevention of Money Laundering Act - A law that was brought in to hack illegal drug trafficking, money laundering & to put a stop to legitimising Black Money has gradually moved on from being a law to a political tool in the hands of the ruling governmentâ€¦be it Congress who politicised it - to BJP that weaponised it. 

A brilliant article in Scroll - https://scroll.in/article/1027571/how-the-modi-government-has-weaponised-the-ed-to-go-after-indias-opposition  - highlights how in the ED has become a force to reckon with & a weapon to intimidate the opposition by the party in power - be in Congress or the BJP. 

Do watch the episode to understand how powerful ED has become after the 2019 amendment & to understand if the PMLA stands constitutionally correct ?

title: Sidhu Moosewala Murder | Revenge or a deeper plot? | The Deshbhakt feat. @Pun_Starr
description:
One month after his shocking death - a lot more details have tumbled out. An international plot that was painstakingly hatched & supported by international arms from across the border. Was it 'just' a gang-war .... was it 'just' a revenge killing or a much more sinister plot?  A special investigation.
  
*****************
Download KukuFM! - https://kukufm.sng.link/Apksi/tx71/fnbi
Use Coupon Code - DB50 (50% off for first 250 people to DOWNLOAD KukuFM!)
******************
Follow PuNsTeRâ„¢ on twitter - @Pun_Starr 
******************************************

PLEASE NOTE 5 POINTS - 
Moosewala's tragic killing is a very emotive issue - as a fan of Punjabi music I know the power that name carried - therefore its obvious there are many versions of the truth that are floating around. We waited for ONE MONTH for the facts to come out before attempting this video and even now so MANY things are not clear and we are getting many questions .... let me attempt to clarify a few and also ask you for more details. But please note - we always don't have direct contact/sources - we also depend on news sources (we tend to read only the reliable ones) 

1. Shagunpreet was not Moosewala's manager ???
Regardless of a few shows or many - there is a clear link and even the Tribune is saying that .... 
https://www.tribuneindia.com/news/punjab/sidhu-moosewalas-manager-shaganpreet-seeks-anticipatory-bail-in-vicky-middukheras-murder-case-407732

2. There is a clear connect with the Bambiha Gang and the songs are not about birds, there might have been pressure on him - but the songs are there - the lyrics are there.
https://indianexpress.com/article/explained/bambiha-gang-sidhu-moosewala-murder-7944447/
https://www.timesnownews.com/mirror-now/in-focus/why-did-sidhu-moose-wala-promote-gun-culture-in-his-songs-was-it-under-the-pressure-of-gangsters-article-91907904

3. Over the question of AN94 being used...right now the Delhi and Punjab police are fighting over that detail  
https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/delhi-police-arrests-sharp-shooters-punjabi-singer-sidhu-moose-wala-murder-1964605-2022-06-20
https://www.indiatoday.in/programme/india-first/video/moose-wala-s-killers-were-provided-an-94-rifles-by-bishnoi-sources-renuka-chowdhury-booked-for-manhandling-cop-more-1963348-2022-06-17

4. What was his last song before death ??
The Last Ride was released on the 15th of May - and Levels 10 days later - so technically it was Levels
https://www.ndtv.com/india-news/in-sidhu-moose-walas-last-song-the-last-ride-fans-find-eerie-similarity-3021293#:~:text=Sidhu%20Moose%20Wala's%20latest%20song,shot%20dead%20on%20Sunday%20evening.

5. Did his father go after him / take his son to hospital ??? 
This is where most of the confusion is - according to the initial police complaint he did trail his sons car & took him to hospital -  though that has been reversed later. We leave you with the clippings to decide.  
https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/sidhu-moose-wala-murder-fir-father-saw-sedan-tailing-car-gangster-threats-1955849-2022-05-30
https://www.theweek.in/news/india/2022/05/30/sidhu-moosewalas-father-went-after-son-with-security-witnessed-his-killing.html

Please send us your NOTES with published news clippings - so that we can do better.

title: Kashmir Files | The Hard Truth Or Vulgar Political Propaganda | Akash Banerjee
description:
The Indian Film Festival (IFFI) Jury Head,  Israeli filmmaker Nadav Lapid, called The Kashmir Files a "propaganda" and a "vulgar movie" - he said that the Jury was "disturbed and shocked" to see the film screened at the festival.

True - The Kashmiri Pandit Tragedy has been a festering would for 30+ years with no clear resolution / justice in sight. Kashmiri Pundits have been continued exploitation by every political party and now their tragedy is being used to sharpen the communal saw. Rather than ensuring a closure - the motive now is to provoke and spread the hate further. We explain why this is dangerous.

In this episode we take a look at the states that went to polls - the results and why congress crashed everywhere and why this self-destruction has been in the making for some time.

title: The Barkha Dutt Interview | "Authority of the Lathi really stood out in the First Wave"
description:
Barkha Dutt is out with her new book - but this one is not just a work of journalism & reportage... this is far more deeper & painfully personal. During her award winning reportage Barkha travelling thousands of kilometres into the interiors of India and for her Covid deaths became more than numbers - they were stories of human beings with names and faces. That pain got more personal when she lost her father to Covid.

In this fireside chat with Barkha we discuss her book - the state of the media - politics and what next for her...

title: 10 Reasons Why | Putin has lost the War (Even if he wins Ukraine)

Putin - even if he wins Kiev now ... has lost the great game of reunification.

title: Ashneer Grover Vs Bharat Pe | From Shark to 81cr. Fraud?? | Akash Banerjee
description:
Bharat Pe - one of India's best known unicorn companies saw a war in the last few days. After an internal investigation showed clear wrongdoing - Madhuri Jain was sacked, but that was just the tip of the iceberg ... a bigger investigation was underway against her husband & company cofounder Ashneer Grover. Ashneer tried to stop the probe and moved court - but that move was rejected and on 1st March - Grover resigned from Bharat Pe as MD.

Now in the latest - the Economic Offence Wing has registered an FIR against Ashneer Grover, his wife Madhuri Jain & family members for defrauding Bharat Pe of Rs. 81cr.

title: Hijab Row: Legal Question or Political Distraction? | Akash Banerjee
description:
What was normal just a short while ago is now controversial with a massive Hijab Protest brewing in Karnataka...perhaps for the first time we are seeing a student vs student battle over dress code & religion. This has forced the Karnataka Govt. to close educational institutions for 3 days. But is wearing Hijab a legal question that needs to be answered in court or is this yet other political distraction? We dig in to understand why this fire is being stoked and by who?

title: CDS Bipin Rawat | What caused the Mi17V5 Crash? | Akash Banerjee
description:
India's first CDS (Chief of Defence Staff), General Bipin Rawat along with his wife & 11 others perished in a Helicopter crash on the 8th of December. Their IAF Mi17-V5 chopper crashed in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday .... final tributes were paid to Gen Rawat today.
Now a Tri-Services Investigation Committee will try to ascertain the exact cause of the accident (that is being seen as one of the WORST in the history of India) but news channels have already speculated on the 'conspiracy' angle & questions have been raised on Helicopter safety. 
For this episode of the Deshbhakt - we spoke with experts to understand what went down, what could have happening and what certainly did not.

title: Modi Repeals Farm Bills | How did Farmers Win? | Akash Banerjee
description:
In a dramatic development PM Modi - in a televised address - announced that the BJP Govt was going to repeal the 3 Farm Bills that had been causing a year long stalemate with the farmers. But the question is - how did the farmers score this massive win - AFTER the Govt had made it clear that it was never going to blink? What were the strategies that the farmers used to survive and outmanoeuvre the Govt? 
We dig in on this big day - with a special tribute episode.

title: Gandhi Jayanti | 5 Myths about Gandhi - Debunked | The Deshbhakt
description:
Mahatma Gandhi, the defining figure of Indian freedom struggle against British colonial rule in India is known by most as an anti-imperialist, whose peaceful non-violent methods helped to overthrow British rule in India. Today there might be trends on social media inspired from the Whatsap university that try to demean father of the Nation and increase the influence of his killer Godse but these fake trends cannot change the course of history and facts.

On the eve of his birthday we debunk 5 common myths about Gandhi that have been repeated often enough that they are considered to be true in todayâ€™s time. 

Thanks to Arjun Pandey & @unofficialgandhi for their deep research into this topic.

title: Nation of Fakirs | Why Citizens happy despite Challenges? | Akash Banerjee
description:
There is a high level of Fakiri in India - only that can explain how citizens are so happy and content with their lives and with the Govt....despite facing inflation, job losses, law & other challenges. The same issues that would have brought people to the streets a few years ago - now dont even merit a discussion! We try to understand the concept of this Fakiri that gives people so much understanding, patience and ability to live with ever decreasing standard of life, wealth & opportunities. 

What do you think is the reason why people are so happy - in the face of so many challenges - what's the mantra ????

title: Explained - Population Control Bill | Masterstroke or Jumla? | Akash Banerjee
description:
ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ SUBSCRIBE FOR MORE VIDEOS ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³  - https://www.youtube.com/thedeshbhakt â–¶ï¸

After years of claiming that our population is our strength - that we will become the industrial hub of the world BECAUSE of our young population - now suddenly Population has become a big cause of concern and the reason for our failed 'Vikas' (or since there are no jobs to be given) 

Uttar Pradesh is leading the charge under CM Adityanath - and the Population Control Bill is supposed to be a gamechanger (read Masterstroke) .... question is for what - the people or the approaching UP Elections?? ;)  

How are elections related to this Bill and is it true that a particular community is responsible for the bulk of population rise in India ???? This episode is a fascinating study in contrast - between facts/data on the ground and the politics that is being played over it!!!!

title: Narendra Modiâ€™s India: From a â€˜Risingâ€™ to a â€˜Settingâ€™ Superpower? |The Deshbhakt with Akash Banerjee
description:
As Narendra Modi completes 7 years in office with one of the largest electoral mandates in the history of India - the country finds itself divided and at war with itself. Where did we go so wrong ???that the rising star of the world - both democratically & economically is today a case study in rising  authoritarianism and sinking economy...
In this episode of The Deshbhakt we take a look at how India abandoned the highway to prosperity and took the narrow path of hate & bigotry. How citizens high on ultranational slogans didn't even see the iceberg of reality when it right there. We also address the question - what can be done now?
Comments welcome. 

#narendramodi #NewIndia #Superpower

title: 10+1 Tips on Fighting Corona (Why it requires a lot of Help & Privilege) | SNL with Akash Banerjee
description:
Exactly a month since I was hit by Corona - still on the road to recovery. But this past one month has shown me just how much support you need to overcome Corona (even if u are lucky enough not to need O2 or a Hospital bed) Even if you are amongst the lucky 85% who recover at home - there is a lot that needs to be done there too....and it's better to be prepared when u know this may hit you any time (not even talking about the THIRD WAVE!) 

I had the privilege of family support and good advice from doctors - will share a few hacks with you and what you should have ready ANYWAYS - because this mess is far from over. It's been a month of staying away from SNL and i have missed you guys as much....

Thanks to your support and that of members - we have cracked 2 million subscribers. Without YouTube members and those on www.patreon.com/thedeshbhakt - this would have been impossible 

Here is the quick access to the 10+1 Tips! 

0:00 - My experience with Covid
5:30 - MOST CRITICAL - know a good Doctor
7:44 - Does your Pharmacy have Covid medicines?
9:21 - Early Detection can save you from Hospitalization 
10:20 - CT Scan's a critical for those in need
11:08 - Dont worry about Fever (worry about O2 levels)
11:50 - The Privilege of 'Home Isolation'
13:41 - The Privilege of someone to help you
15:35 - Food (as important as medication) 
16:01 - Oximeter / Steaming / Nebulization - your new BBF
16:47 - Post Covid Awareness (where people slip)  
18:12 - This is a Mental battle as well.

title: Massive Unemployment | India's Dream Demographic Dividend now a Nightmare? | Akash Banerjee
description:
For years we've been shown the dream of India's #DemographicDividend - that stage where favourable population dynamics will fuel rapid economic growth....but sadly the data is telling us an opposite story - according to CMIE -  "the working age population has INCREASED by 11.22 crore between May '16 & Feb '21, but the total labour force as such has FALLEN by 2.99 crore"

In the face of massive unemployment, the latest episode of Deshbhakt takes a deep dive into the issue of #Unemplyment and understand why trends like #ModiRozgarDo are becoming all too common. 

This episode has been done in collaboration with the fabulous #VivekKaul who did the real number crunching and went over the CMIE data - READ THE FULL ARTICLE HERE -  https://vivekkaul.com/tag/unemployment/

title: Nikita Tomar Case | Why India needs a SCAW now! Akash Banerjee
description:
A 21 year old #NikitaTomar got a bullet in the head from her stalker #Tauseef because she dared to say to her advances and also lodged a complaint against him. NIkita's family says that Tauseef was related to a Congress politician and was demanding that Nikita convert and marry him. 

While there is a debate on the 'love jihad' angle of the same - there is one thing that has become clear. There is no fear of the law when it comes to crimes against women. That is why Team Deshbhakt is asking the Govt to form a #SCAW Division immediately. The Serious Crimes Against Women Division will track heinous crimes against women and insure that the trial is quick and solid as well. 

Do have a look at this proposal and support us in getting this message to all. 

Chapter Heads -

00:00 - What happened to Nikita 
02:10 - How law and order is mocked by people like Tauseef
02:30 - What is SCAW / Why do we need it now
04:30 - Powers of the SCAW Division 
05:40 - What is the SFIO and how the blueprint is already there
06:20 - We already have OCSAE to safeguard teens 
07:07 - Why we need a long term solution and not short term outrage

title: 'Filthy' - India's Air Pollution Problem & our annual outrage | SNL with Akash Banerjee
description:
So now our air quality comes up in a US Presidential Debate - but despite the international alarm over India's worsening air quality - we seem to be in a snooze mode. Even here the chalta hai attitude seem to be working - and precious little being done on the ground. 

Every year like clockwork - there are allegations and counter allegations - some assurances are made - some studies are conducted and in the end there is no consensus over what even causes this mayhem!   

ON SNL - we begin with some data and facts that the govt does not want you to know.... then of course your questions!

title: Remembering the JP Movement & the Right to Protest | SNL | The Deshbhakt with Akash Banerjee
description:
11th October is the Birthday of Jayaprakash Narayan, popularly referred to as JP. He passed away in 1979 and was responsible for some of the largest political movements in the history of Independent India. 

Had JP tried his political activism today - he may have been jailed under UAPA and the SC would have told him that he could no agitate in public spaces. 

Yet the JP movement rattled the authoritarian force that Indira Gandhi was - it was his movement that led to IG being thrown out of power post Emergency. The Congress was never the same after JP.    

On the eve of his birthday - discussing dissent & protest on SNL!

title: Chetan Bhagat: We have to stop dreaming of greatness & get to work! | Deshbhakt Conversations
description:
Like him or not - agree with him or disagree - but Chetan Bhagat speaks his mind. He does not shy from a fight and is open to correcting his POV as time goes by. In this extremely frank and blunt video-podcast - Bhagat talks about how social media is distracting an entire generation, (why Gandhi may have failed to rally the young if the British had 4G!) .... also why we should stop daydreaming about our 'greatness' and actually get down to work.

Does Chetan Bhagat consider himself a 'Modi Fanboy' and when did he start becoming critical of the Govt again? Bhagat also discusses his writing - his new (and 9th) novel - One Arranged Murder and why creative pursuits look easy - but involve a lot of legwork.

title: Manmohan Singh - A Nation in 69 remembers a man of 88! | SNL | The Deshbhakt | Akash Banerjee
description:
Six years ago - today we would have been a flood of jokes on Manmohan Singh - but not today. In fact to the contrary - many miss his quiet demeanor and ability to steer the nation in difficult times. Many (including myself) find that we judged the man too harshly - and while the Congress has still a lot to answer for - MMS clearly is being judged a lot more kindly than 6 years ago. We remember the highlights of his career that give us economic liberalization (as FM) and double digit GDP growth (as PM)

Also your questions, from Bollywood under fire to Deepika Padukone and Sara Ali Khan being questioned. From Anil Ambani facing the questions from court to the Farmers questioning the Farmer Bill!  

00:00 - Happy Birthday Dr. Manmohan Singh !
20:09 - Dr. MMS used to answer every question in Press Conference, can we expect the same from current PM?
23:05 - Why did I not vacate the office in lockdown?
30:50 - Implementation of government policies : Emperors new clothes !
37:55 - Farmers being handed over to Private organizations.
45:15 - Umar Khalid case - 11 Lakh pages !!!
51:28 - Do I feel safe in today's times?
1:17:54 - Why India is Quasi-federal?

title: Prashant Bhushan: On Courts / Modi / Kejriwal & more  | Deshbhakt Conversations with Akash Banerjee
description:
JOIN this Channel as a DeshBhakt Member to get access to perks/chats/discord server/content/podcasts
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmTM_hPCeckqN3cPWtYZZcg/join

Lawyer-activist Prashant Bhushan has been hitting the headlines of late (again) - this time for 'scandalizing the court' and posting tweets that were in 'contempt'. Be it mocking the present CJI SA Bobde for sitting atop a 50 lakh bike or raising questions over the actions of past 4 SC Chief Justices....Prashant Bhushan has been relentless in questioning the judicial system.  

After a lot of heated arguments and asking for a sorry - the top court fined him a grand total of Re 1. While the verdict can be termed as a moral victory for Bhushan, the case left the country pondering over the current state of judicial system and many are raising questions over the working of the courts.

This Teachers Day - Prashant Bhushan sits down with us for a detailed conversation and lesson in civic duty. Prashant talks in detail about the judicial system, freedom of speech, his fallout with Arvind Kejriwal and much more.

Chapter Heads:

00:00 - Conversation with Prashant Bhushan
03:19 - Contempt of Court - Guilty? (Since u paid the fine!)
06:36 - How much pressure on you to say a simple sorry?
10:03 - Justice Karnan got 6 months - you paid Re.1 - Hypocrisy Much?
12:31 - Was your case an unnecessary waste of the SCâ€™s time?
15:36 - Does the SC itself need to introspect?
19:21 - Is our Judiciary still autonomous - or does it need Aazadi?
21:56 - Is the â€œDarkest hour of SCâ€ back to haunt us?
24:46 - What would you do for imprisoned activists who raised their voice?
29:21 - Looking back - do you regret being part of IAC movement?
31:21 - Did the BJP really prop up IAC?
34:06 - What is the Politics of Arvind Kejriwal?
40:01 - Where is Anna Hazare?
43:56 - Should good people enter Politics - and CAN they today?
50:11 - Is the Media killing Democracy?
53:11 - What is in greater danger : Hindus/Minorities/Economy/Constitution?
56:41 - Lowest point in your Career - the physical assault on you?
58:11 - How to educate ourselves in matters of Law & Constitution?
59:01 - 1 question each for - Modi, Gogoi and Kejriwal?

title: India's GDP Crash: Act of God? Or Act of Fraud? | The Deshbhakt with Akash Banerjee
description:
Shoutout to Kuvera! - Download the app: http://bit.ly/2Xo9Jly
Invest in Direct Mutual Funds and gold for free on Kuvera. Create an account on Kuvera today and be the first to find about an amazing new shopping offer from Amazon. Don't miss it!
---

India's gross domestic product or GDP contracted by a massive MINUS 23.9% in the April-June period, that is what the official NSO data said. The data revealed that majority of the sectors are hit by a negative growth after the lockdown - making this the worst economic stump in India and also the in the world amongst big economies.

However in this edition of the deshbhakt we are going to take a look at how India's GDP was anyways on a downward spiral BEFORE the virus struck - making the cut deeper for India than any other country. Even before the lockdown, GDP growth was declining since the last eight quarters.

The Finance Minister has already said that this time, the decline in growth is an â€˜act of Godâ€™ - however data shows that an act of Fraud has been committed and this depression is not going away any time soon.

title: The Ravish Kumar Interview (Part 1) | The Deshbhakt Conversations with Akash Banerjee
description:
#Magsaysay award winner and Sr. Executive Editor at #NDTV - #Ravish Kumar is an icon for many, who see him as a journalism who speaks for the public. He is also disliked in equal measure by a vast section of the population - for this stinging critique of the Government and probing questions.

With Bihar Elections around the bend, an opposition that has collapsed, democratic institutions that have just given up - we sit down with Ravish for a extended fireside chat on what is going on in India and where we are headed. 

From Politics to People - Elections to Entertainment ... Ravish touches on everything in this inimitable style and candor. In Part 1 of this 2 hour long conversation - Ravish also comes down heavy on citizens as well .... the class that has lost its voice and its ability to see clearly. He refutes the claim that the job of opposition is only for the parties.

07:15 - Is Ravish an Anti-national?

title: Why Prashant Bhushan Refused to Apologise to the Supreme Court | The Deshbhakt with Akash Banerjee
description:

In a day of dramatic developments in the Supreme Court of India - Prashant Bhushan stood his ground when asked if he would consider an apology. Not even wanting the extra days that were being offered for a â€˜rethinkâ€™ - a combative Bhushan said "I do not ask for mercy. I do not appeal for magnanimity. I cheerfully submit to any punishment that the court may impose.â€

In this special episode of the deshbhakt we recreate what happened in the apex court (since sadly - proceedings are still off-camera) Bhushan clearly is now ready to face action because he says that his core complaint and explanations were not heeded to. Will the court now find a way out in 2 days - will Bhushanâ€™s point be heard - or will other voice be drowned! Also important to hear how arguments are carried out in the top court (detailed article / tweets attached below) 

Now the SC has given Bhushan time till August 24 to submit an unconditional apology - failing which the court will pronounce it's order on punishment to be handed down to Bhushan.

title: The Stunning Silence of Arvind Kejriwal | Analysis by Akash Banerjee on The Deshbhakt
description:
Once known as a 'revolutionary leader' in #IndianPolitics..... today (after a string of U-Turns) finds himself in a locked cage with nowhere to go. In the last few months, Arvind Kejriwal has deliberately avoided commenting or criticizing the Government on major issues such as Article 370 and CAA. After winning the Delhi elections in February this year...Kejriwal has become a voice that echoes what Modi or Amit Shah has to say. Also Kejriwal's report card has been questable of late - especially when it comes to handling the medical crisis in the capital. 
 
In this Episode of the DeshBhakt, we discuss the shift in Kejriwalâ€™s political strategy over the years and try to figure out where exactly did Arvind Kejriwal lose his â€˜significanceâ€™ in Indian Politics....and why exactly is he so quiet??? 
 
#Kejriwal #Delhi #Modi

title: Why are old neighbourhood allies, turning against India?? | DeshBhakt Analysis with Akash Banerjee
description:
Episode Chapters:
00:00 - India's Neighbourhood
02:38 - China: Goons in Galwan 
03:58 - Nepal: A friend turned Foe 
05:02 - Bangladesh: Signs of insecurity?
06:25 - Indonesia and Malaysia: Cutting criticism 
07:02 - Pakistan: Bleeding India with 2000 cuts 
07:40 - Sri Lanka & Myanmar: Chinaâ€™s proxy weapons
 
India has been known for adopting  a â€œneighbourhood firstâ€ and a â€œLook eastâ€ policy- wherein we have hoped and aimed towards inculcating better ties with our neighbours and the South East Asian states. The NDA government that came to power in 2014 also carried forward this legacy and shared the same ideology.

However, the last few months have heralded a new, but alarming chapter in our peaceful approach. Relations with countries like Nepal, Bangladesh, Myanmar and Indonesia- which were extremely tranquil- have now begun to sour. 

Meanwhile, the progress that we seemed to have made with our adversaries, China and Pakistan, have also diminished. In this episode of the Deshbhakt, we try to understand what issues led to the weakening of ties between India and its neighbours and what role did China have to play in all this disorder.....also - what were we doing when China was making its moves.

title: State of Indian Economy (After 3 months of Lockdown) | Livestream with Vivek Kaul & Akash Banerjee
description:
3 months is a long time in politics and even longer when it comes to Economy. So what has happened to our economic machinery in the last 90 days of Lockdown and how do the next 90 days look. Also the brewing troubles with China and the banning of 59 Chinese Apps. 

After Migrants - who will be hit next? How much has the Govt managed to help and can there be partial reopening of the Economy now? + Deshbhakt Member Questions from the Discord Server!

title: Nepotism In Indian Politics | INC vs BJP - Who Wins? | Analysis by Akash Banerjee on The Deshbhakt
description:
JOIN the DeshBhakt Channel to get acess to Exclusive Discord Server / Podcast and Interviews!! -  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmTM_hPCeckqN3cPWtYZZcg/join

Chapter Heads :
00:00 Dynasty vs Democracy: A history 
02:36 Family trend in the Congress/70 saal wali party!! 
03:58 Has BJP put an end to the â€œFamily Trendâ€?
09:24 Nepotism in the regional parties :(
 
Despite being a democracy, the Indian political space has been dominated by certain families and ruling 'dynasts' .... Year after year, we see their numbers rising in both the Centre as well as at the state legislatives.  The Congress is held responsible for the genesis of this problem ... #NehruKiGalti (!!) and the BJP/NDA government was hailed as a liberator....a party that will respect only merit. 

But has the BJP truly done that?

In this episode of the Deshbhakt, we try to find out whether the conundrum of dynastic politics has indeed been solved by the BJP? What about other regional parties? Are they any better than the Congress when it comes to Nepotism? Could nepotism be one of the reasons why democracy is slowly being throttled in India?

title: Pratik Sinha & Alt News - Fighting the Misinformation Pandemic | SNL with Akash Banerjee
description:

title: Emergency In India - Part 2 (How Quickly Democracy can Crumble) | Akash Banerjee
description:
When the press is censored, students are detained, opposition is absent, and the country is going through a state of emergency...it is democracy that suffers. 

When the Prime Minister considers himself as the ruler; any voice of dissent is crippled and fundamental rights are being denied. 

We have seen throughout the course of history how an overbearing leader drunk on power and fame can take steps that lead to democratic upheaval. Not very far ago in history - we had the National Emergency imposed by Indira Gandhi - question is - have we learnt anything from that lesson? 

In this episode of TheDeshbhakt, weâ€™ll talk about the  Emergency that has left a permanent stain on Indian Democracy. It has been 45 years since then and we are forgetting the lessons that Emergency taught us. Watch the full episode to find out why we need to revisit Emergency 1975 in 2020.    

#emergencyinindia #akashbanerjee #emergency

title: Emergency In India - Part 1 (When the Supreme Court let us Down) | Akash Banerjee
description:
Whenever there is an emergency like situation in the country and the fundamental rights of citizens are threatened - it's the Supreme Court that steps in to protect our rights / democracy and the constitution. 

But when the judiciary fails to perform its duty, all democratic institutions can come under the influence of a powerful government and the fundamental rights of citizens go for a toss....There also have been instances when various High Courts fought for the rights and security of every citizen of the country; but the Supreme Court overruled such judgements and failed to provide justice.

This Deshbhakt Special Educational Episode - takes a look at the darkest hour of the Indian judiciary - when even the apex court failed to live up to the values enshrined in our constitution.....so the Supreme Court of India fallible ??? Let's find out!!!

Brilliant thumbnail image via - https://www.barandbench.com/ 
********************************************

Chapter Heads :
0:00 - THE EMERGENCY 
2:36 - KESAVANANDA BHARATI CASE- COURTS VS PARLIAMENT
4:54 - RAJ NARAIN VS INDIRA GANDHI- THE BEGINNING OF EMERGENCY
7:38 - BASIC RIGHTS VS SUPREME COURT
9:45 - HABEAS CORPUS CASES VS SUPREME COURT

title: Helping Our Migrants Get Home with Dignity! | Saturday Night Livestream with Akash Banerjee
description:
DONATION LINK - https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/sponsor-a-bus-for-migrants-help-indias-workers-and-their-families-reach?payment=form

We begin this SNL with something special and unique - a LOT of deshbhakts - from around the world ask - how can we help in the ongoing migrant crisis in India. There are lakhs of migrants still waiting to go home and trains are full to the brim 

This is where NGO like Karwan e Mohabbat come in - they have been doing some great work - feeding and sending migrants home on busses free of cost. (because most dont even have that sort of money)  

Harsh Mander is a name we all know and he has been doing some great work for the voiceless. So tonight we have him on SNL and we can discuss - what next - in India's worst internal migration crisis ever.  

+ your questions as always in the second of SNL! 

DETAILS OF THIS FUND RASER  CAN BE FOUND ON THE KETTO WEBSITE

title: #BoycottChina - Can Indiaâ€™s wallet beat Chinaâ€™s bullet? | Akash Banerjee
description:
Massive outrage followed after thousands of Chinese troops entered the Indian territory in Ladakhâ€™s Galwan Valley.  While the Indian Government initially denied all claims of any dispute with China, the situation on the border has only got more tangled. 

After the Ladakh Stand-off, a widely popular call for boycotting Chinese products went around. The aim? - to teach China a lesson.
 
Education reformist Sonam Wangchuk came up with a video in which he asked Indians to boycott Chinese apps within a week and Chinese products in a year. But sadly the situation between India and Chain is much deeper than toys and phones ... For Example most of our startup system is funded by Chinese money. 

In this Episode of The DeshBhakt, we raise a few fundamental questions:

- Is boycotting Chinese products the best option available to us?
- Which country will it affect more- China or India?
- What is a better approach towards the issue?

***** India vs China- Chapter Heads :***** 

1:33 - Logic Behind the Call               
1:54 - China China everywhere       
6:53 - How to escape the dragon
7:23 - Diversify Imports
7:36 - Rectify Mistakes, Increase FDI

8:24 - Atmanirbhar Defence
9:03 - Need to be China's Alternative

title: 10 Lessons in Nationalism that would make Tagore Anti-National today | TheDeshbhakt | Akash Banerjee
description:
Rabindranath Tagore has been the most celebrated poet and intellectual in pre-independence India. The creator of our national anthem is known to have controversial thoughts regarding nationalism and patriotism. In his book Nationalism, he talked openly on how nationalism corrupts the population to gain power while the ultimate object of unity and equality is left behind. He was also an ardent defender of dissent and was known to have questioned even the father of our nation, Mahatma Gandhi. In todayâ€™s India, where dissent and disagreement are considered anti-national and nationalism has become a proof of your identity, will the Nobel Laureate Tagore himself be considered anti-India, a member of Tukde-Tukde gang?

On the 159th birth anniversary of Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore, weâ€™ll talk about 10 most important and most controversial thoughts of Tagore on Nationalism. Watch the full episode of TheDeshbhakt to see why Bhakt Banerjee is angry with Tagore. 

********* CHAPTERHEADS*******
0:00 'Anti-National' Points made by Tagore
2:17 - Nationalism - A Virus!!!!??? 
3:47 - A Nation is not to be Worshipped
4:52 - Seditious Thinking of Tagore 
5:56 - Tagore Vs. Gandhi - the art of debate
7:35 - Where the Mind is Free... (so are we?)
9:15 - Tagore against Indian 'History'
10:45 - Tagore part of Award Vapasi Gang!!!!
11:42 - We don't need no Education (at least this sort)
12:56 - Tagore's Warning on 'Divide-and-Rule' 
14:50 - No to Citizenship 'Amendment'

title: 75 Years After Hitler - How History is Repeating Itself All Over the World | Akash Banerjee
description:
It's been 75 years since #Hitler was cornered in his bunker and his evil reign came to an end. But decades down the line there is a worldwide resurgence of authoritarian governments using the same tricks and strategies that were witnessed in Germany ... so many years ago. An army of people working to spread propaganda, to cripple voices of dissent and blaming a community to blame for the country's ills. 

Hitler may be gone - but is the ideology he mastered - coming back to haunt us ??  Are we seeing many countries making the same mistake?? Many being unable to see the same signals that were there in the Germany of 1930s ???

description:
Much before he was arrested by the Delhi Police - Umar Khalid knew that something was being done to put him in his place. In April - as the crackdown on the CAA protestors got underway - he sat down for a 90 minute - unfiltered Q & A session 

Umar Khalid KNEW that he would be probed under UAPA - but the former JNU student leader was unfazed .... over the course of this livestream Khalid took any and every question (including how he may be helping Modi build a narrative) .... 

The first 30 minutes of this interview are questions sent in from our patrons and youtube members - 
at https://www.patreon.com/thedeshbhakt & https://www.youtube.com/thedeshbhakt/JOIN

title: What After Janta Curfew - 10 Points | Not the Nine O'Clock News with Akash Banerjee
description:
*************************************************
Subscribe karke BELL ICON dabaya kya?! :) - https://www.youtube.com/thedeshbhakt
*************************************************
Chapter-heads 
1:02 Corona returns to China (after thali peetoing)  
1:49 - Importance of social isolation and why that is the last hope
3:12 - Initiative of the Govt for Doctors seriously lacking?
4:53 - Govt strategy for tackling the situation (if any)
5:44 - Are we ready yet- despite the time we had?

Since there is not much real news happening at 9PM - here is NOT the news that you get on TV! Now that India has suddenly realised the gravity of the situation and is closing everything - from trains to cities - can the Govt please give us more data of what is really happening? And EVEN NOW we are making people believe that banging plates is going to solve the problem. (BTW more this 'gratitude' - docs need kits and equipment to do their jobs!) 

10 quick points on what is going on - and where we head to next!

title: Paid Media vs People of Delhi - Is free / subsidised utilities good governance or 'Mufatkhori'??
description:
Subscribe karke BELL ICON dabaya kya?! :) - https://www.youtube.com/thedeshbhakt
****************
Arvind Kejriwal may have won the Delhi CMship for a third time - but after trying to mat him on the question of Pakistan / Biryani and CAA - the new allegation against him is that Kejriwal won Delhi on the basis of 'freebies' and that the population of Delhi is 'mufatkhors' or lovers of things free - so much so that they will vote for Imran Khan if he gives them free goodies.

At a time when delivering free utilities like public transport is a growing global trend - desperate anchors are trying to make their masters happy by making voters into villains - but the people of Delhi will have one bit of this. Team deshbhakt asked Dilliwallas what they thought of Sudhir and his 'Mufatkhor' charge!

title: Hindutva Will Destroy Us! - Ramachandra Guha Vs Bhakt Banerjee
description:
***** CHAPTER HEADS********

4:20 - The Golden Rule of Indian Politics
7:08 - Nehru - "Greatest danger to India is the RSS"
11:18 - RSS and Indian Freedom Movement? Any Links?
13:54 - Gandhi was responsible for the Partition?
16:09 - Can RSS be compared to Hamas!?
19:46 - Why is Ram Guha Anti-CAA?
27:25 - Why Ram Guha is scared of Hindutva?
30:06 - Guha - "Hindutva will destroy us"
31:31 - What is the importance of Gandhi today?
34:36 - Guha - "Savarkar gave ideological direction to Godse"
36:37 - Guha "Like Indira Gandhi was Iron lady - Modiji is Iron Man"
39:33 - If not Modi than WHO?

****************************
In one of the biggest Interviews of the year...Bhakt Banerjee goes up against noted historian (and celebrated Urban Naxal) - Ramachandra Guha. Dr. Guha recently appeared to redeem himself when he called Rahul Gandhi a 5th Generation Politician that young India didn't want. 

Expecting to convert Ram Guha to Modi's side BB sits down with the man - only to discover that Guha continues to be as negative about Modi and the RSS as he always was. EVEN saying that Hindutva will destroy the nation and that RSS can be compared to Hamas!!!! 

However on the question of Gandhi and Nehru - Bhakt Banerjee corners Guha and also the question of ignoring Savarkar's role in our freedom struggle. 

Watch his biggest battle that BB has fought for the history of India and SEE WHO WINS!!!!

title: Tukde Tukde Narratives: How The Government Distracts India from Core issues | Ep.109 The DeshBhakt
description:
Recently, FM Nirmala Sitharaman claimed that millennials prefer Ola/Uber cabs over buying cars and hence there is a slowdown in automobile sector. This is not the first time when the Government has tried to excuse itself from any governance failure.
 
It seems to be a policy now - to divert people from real issues - using false narratives....from Hindu Khate Mein Hain to Khan Market Gang. The liberals too spend most of their time frothing other such name calling. 

In this episode of the Deshbhakt, we take a 5 year view of all the catchphrases that were developed by the IT Cell and the public got fooled and distracted form core issues!
