title: Chandrayaan - The Incredible Rise of ISRO & how it bounces back from Failures | Akash Banerjee
description:
While ISRO did confirm the loss of contact with Chandrayaan-2 lander, Vikram but is a small setback - compared to what ISRO has already overcome. 2019 also marks 50 years of ISRO's journey - that has seen the organisation deliver technologies like PSLV / GSLV and missions like Chandrayaan-1, Mangalyaan and many more. 

The reason why ISRO will bounce back from this setback -is because from the start, ISRO had learnt how to deal with failure. It has been ISRO's habit to back come stronger after its failures.
Ep.108 of The Deshbhakt takes a quick look though 50 years of ISRO to find out how odds and failures were beaten back at EVERY step of the way to today - where India is a space superpower. 

#chandrayaan3 #isro #akashbanerjee

title: Unemployability: The reality of Indiaâ€™s job crisis & how u can beat it | Ep.107 #TheDeshBhakt
description:
Shoutout to our sponsors of this episode Cambly
https://www.cambly.com/en/student/subscribe?promoCode=akashbanerjee

Download Cambly App and use Coupon Code: AKASHBANERJEE to get a 32% discount.


With a deteriorating economy, India's job crisis is expected to worsen in the coming future. Even engineers, doctors & MBAs are struggling to get jobs in their respective fields.

However, market condition is not the ONLY factor for India's jobs crisis. Lack of skills amongst graduates and increasing automation in the market has also resulted in joblessness. Unemployability in India is serious concern and has been caused due to bad policy / teaching and colleges.  

Our Teachers Day Special - Episode 107 of TheDeshBhakt, we take a look at the unemployability crisis and how upskilling using tech could be a possible solution. That education system has failed to educate the masses is not a secret - but can technology step in to bridge the gap?????

title: India's Economic Crisis - did we respond in time? | Analysis by Akash Banerjee on The DeshBhakt
description:
Subscribe karke BELL ICON dabaya kya?! :) - https://www.youtube.com/thedeshbhakt/JOIN

*****************************************************************************
Today India's economy is in serious trouble - already in the ICU - now has to face a global challenge. But the scale of our economic meltdown could have been reduced if we acted earlier - the warning signs have been there for a long time and all key indicators went south 9 months ago. But we kept saying Saab Changa Si! 

In August 2019 we made this episode that took a hard look at Demand - Investments - Job losses - Rupee is getting weaker - Stock market is getting battered. HAD the Government focused on reviving the Indian economy instead of focusing on popular politics, we would have been better today. But for that the Govt. first needed to admit that there was a crisis.

title: The Horrors of Partition & why we need to Remember it | Akash Banerjee
description:
As India celebrates it's 75th Independence day - The Deshbhakt remembers the Partition and how India was divided by the British after repeated attempts. (and how attempts are being made even today)

Every year, we celebrate Independence day with pride and fervour, but we want to bury the memories of partition and the cost at which Independence was served. Partition of India and Pakistan is a dark chapter in the history of the subcontinent - something we would like to forget.

The DeshBhakt, we track the years before partition, what caused the rift between Congress and the Muslim League - how the British were successful in dividing us -  and why we are STILL not learning the lessons of Partition.

title: DeshBhakt Interviews - Can the Left ever rise up again? | Sitaram Yechury admits glaring lapses
description:
With BJP's thumping victory in Lok Sabha Elections 2019 - its not just Congress that is looking at an abyss. The Left Parties have been virtually reduced to zero with no hope in sight. 

What happened to a force that commanded 60 MPs just a few years go and controlled UPA1? - we sit down with Sitaram Yechury to have an honest fireside chat and understand what went wrong with the Left?

Tons of questions sourced from Social Media and especially - patreon.com/thedeshbhakt. 

While Sitaram does answer the questions with remarkable honestly and admission of slipping - question is DOES HE HAVE  solution to making the Left the voice of the oppressed and the working classes?

title: Understanding Kashmir: Kashmiri Pandits, Insurgency & AFSPA | Ep. 100(Part2) | The DeshBhakt
description:
Watch the first part of Understanding Kashmir by clicking the link below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IEfIMHjKp-c&t=2s

In Episode 100 (Part 2) of TheDeshbhakt, we explain the plight of Kashmiri Pandits, the origin of insurgency in Kashmir, AFSPA, and possible solutions the Modi Government can take in order to solve the Kashmir problem. Also the voice we need to hear the most - but dont. 

Kashmir issue, ever since independence, has been a sensitive topic, even though real information is scarcely consumed. In Part of this series we covered the history and struggle of Kashmir, Article 370 and Article 35A...we tried to understand why despite decades of intervention - why the Kashmir conflict remains unsolved.

By no means, this is a complete history of the state - just an attempt to explain some knotty issues / keeping facts in mind and going easy on the emotions.

title: Understanding Kashmir: History, Article 370 & Article 35a | Ep.100 The DeshBhakt with Akash Banerjee
description:
Watch the second part of Understanding Kashmir by clicking the link below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HiS2xW3tXSw

The Kashmir Issue - ever since independence, has been a sensitive and debatable topic for both India and Pakistan. Despite the emotions surrounding the topic - very few know about the history and struggle of Kashmir.

What is Article 370 and Article 35A?
Why have all parties failed to resolve Kashmir - even after India and Pakistan fighting several wars over it - despite the United Nations intervening - in spite of SEVEN DECADES having passed?? 

In Part 1 of Episode 100 - #TheDeshBhakt; we make an attempt to untangle and explain the Kashmir conflict.

WARNING _ by no means this is a complete history of the state / just an attempt to explain a knotty issue / keeping facts in mind and going easy on the emotions.

title: Leila Review: 10 Reasons why the Netflix series is too close to todays India | Ep.95 The DeshBhakt
description:
Netflixâ€™s latest series Leila has raised a controversy as soon as it got released on June 14. Based on the novel by Prayag Akbar with the same name, Deepa Mehtaâ€™s adaptation of this dystopian thriller is facing objections on the name of religion and its over-the-top
authoritarian government. 

But could it be that the REAL problem with Leila is not that it is too extreme - but that it is too real many a times? 

The series is set in a technologically advanced but a radicalised country, Aryavart in the year of 2049. It also outlines the environmental issues like heavy air pollution, water
crisis that can be seen evidently in present scenario too.
DeshBhakt found 10 clear instances when Leila got too close to reality......

title: Real Estate & Shadow Banking - India's looming crisis | Ep.90 #TheDeshBhakt with Akash Banerjee
description:
The Real Estate industry has been struggling for some time now. With the money from shadow banking sector drying up & the economy tanking - the Real Estate bubble is set for a massive implosion. 

Jaypee Wishtown - that is making the headlines - is just a tip of the iceberg. India's largest real-estate meltdown will see another Jet Airways happen - rendering 20,000 families homeless and robbing them of their life's earnings (including that of my parents) .... with 7 LAKH UNSOLD HOUSES THIS IS MEGA CRISIS WAITING TO HAPPEN. 

As I researched into Jaypee's criminal misuse of funds - i found layers of fraudulent behaviour and shady funding that was kept afloat with the principle - that INDIANS WILL ALWAYS BUY A HOUSE, NO MATTER WHAT THE PRICE. 

This axiom held true for some time - but now karma has come to the bite the industry and the ones to suffer (as always) will be the sorry middle class buyer.

title: The Shashi Tharoor Interview with The Deshbhakt Akash Banerjee
description:
In one of his most extensive interviews till date, Shashi Tharoor speaks to The Deshbhakt for close to an hour on a wide range of issues. From Narendra Modi insulting sanskriti â€“ by dragging Rajiv Gandhiâ€™s name into the election slugfest - to how the Sabrimala issue cannot be looked at only with the lens of Civil Law. 

While the Indian National Congress did take time to bounce back from the 2014 debacle, Tharoor says that the party and Rahul Gandhi has done a lot of good work in terms of leadership and communication. He believes that given the inputs from the first few rounds of polling - the BJP is going to be history on the 23rd of May. 

Tharoor also takes some tough punches on Rahul Gandhiâ€™s leadership, nepotism in the Congress and the Sunanda Pushkar case that the police is dragging its feet on. He also makes a strong point on how Hindutva needs to be seen as the opposite of the Hindu religion - and nothing more than a political ideology. 

Watch Tharoor at his candid best â€“ with questions coming in from social media and from the Deshbhakt toli on patreon.com/akashbanerjee who virtually set the question paper for Tharoor.

title: Kissa Kursi Ka | India's finest political satire movie? | Akash Banerjee
description:
In the midst of the choking Emergency that Indira Gandhi had imposed - was born a movie that was destined to be banned from the word go - but one that would help in he downfall of Sanjay Gandhi.  

Kissa Kursi Ka - despite its shoddy production values - has very limited competition in terms of peers when it comes to Political Satire in Bollywood. Released in the middle of the emergency - it dared to mock the Gandhis and mock the hollowness of netas - no surprise, it faced the wrath of Sanjay Gandhi. 

But the face of politicians it showed then - the ways of their operation and the greed of the netas - all fit in excellently well today - 40 years+ down the line, NOTHING really has changed in the way politicians and politics works in this nation.
